0: Wayne Lotter Credit: PAMS Foundation NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Wayne Lotter, the co-founder and president of conservation organisation PAMS Foundation, has been shot dead by gunmen in Tanzania. The 51-year-old, from South Africa, was killed late on Wednesday night while travelling in a taxi through the city of Dar es Salaam, in an attack that is currently being investigated by police. In a Facebook post following his death, PAMS Foundation said they were "heartbroken" by the news and remembered the keen conservationist for his "charm, brilliance and eccentric sense of humour".
